posts.post_content: Fun with a good Thallid deck. throw in Seed the Land and Beacon of Nature and you've got lots of tokens even without a Mycoloth or Doubling Season. Of course you'll want an Essence Warden to get your life gain on. It won't be a perfect deck but it'll be fun. If you really want to make someone's mind melt, do Life and Limb (all saps are forests, all forests are saps), Ambush Commander (forests you control are 1/1 elf creatures) and a Hivestone - so now all your forests are Elf-Saproling-Forest-Slivers. Wrap your head around what THAT must look like.
posts.html:

Of course you'll want an Essence Warden to get your life gain on. It won't be a perfect deck but it'll be fun. If you really want to make someone's mind melt, do Life and Limb (all saps are forests, all forests are saps), Ambush Commander (forests you control are 1/1 elf creatures) and a Hivestone - so now all your forests are Elf-Saproling-Forest-Slivers. Wrap your head around what THAT must look like.

posts.post_content:
I'm planning to use it in my [Rith, the Awakener](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rith, the Awakener) EDH.  
In order not to lose forests, I've swapped most of them for nonbasic green-producing lands such as [Oran-Rief, the Vastwood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oran-Rief, the Vastwood), [Mosswort Bridge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mosswort Bridge), [Khalni Garden](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Khalni Garden) and [Llanowar Reborn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Llanowar Reborn). There's also a [Terra Eternal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terra Eternal) there for the few basics.   
With my lands safe, I can move on to say it combos deliciously with Rith. And with [Rampagin Baloths](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rampagin Baloths), [Emeria Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emeria Angel) and any saproling maker.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
@Kyrthain  
  
Unless it says "Saproling spells" or "Saproling cards" then it implicitly refers to Saproling permanents. There are no tribal changeling enchantments but if there were, those would be Saproling permanents and thus turn into forests.
posts.html:
@Kyrthain

Unless it says "Saproling spells" or "Saproling cards" then it implicitly refers to Saproling permanents. There are no tribal changeling enchantments but if there were, those would be Saproling permanents and thus turn into forests.

Posted By: Geebus (5/11/2012 2:17:42 PM)

posts.post_content:
The threat of mass creature removal is obviously the biggest concern among people here, especially the cheap kind like [Zealous Persecution](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zealous Persecution), and [Soul Suffers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soul Suffers).  
  
Really, the best way to survive that is to have a hybrid deck with other unaffected colors and non-green fetchlands like [Terramorphic Expanse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terramorphic Expanse).  
  
My deck is half green and half white/black. With this combination, I can consistently summon [Ghave, Guru of Spores](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ghave, Guru of Spores) who can help stave off the cheap -1/-1 wipes by turning those Saprolings into to +1/+1 counters, buffing my other creatures up past the danger point.  
  
This added versatility also makes it significantly easier to maneuver against fewer big creatures or more small creatures.  
  
Of course if you guys are just getting hit with [Wrath of God](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrath of God) all the time, and don't want to do all that, just use [Terra Eternal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terra Eternal).
posts.html:
The threat of mass creature removal is obviously the biggest concern among people here, especially the cheap kind like Zealous Persecution, and Soul Suffers.

Really, the best way to survive that is to have a hybrid deck with other unaffected colors and non-green fetchlands like Terramorphic Expanse.

My deck is half green and half white/black. With this combination, I can consistently summon Ghave, Guru of Spores who can help stave off the cheap -1/-1 wipes by turning those Saprolings into to +1/+1 counters, buffing my other creatures up past the danger point.

This added versatility also makes it significantly easier to maneuver against fewer big creatures or more small creatures.

Of course if you guys are just getting hit with Wrath of God all the time, and don't want to do all that, just use Terra Eternal.

Mix with [utopia mycon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=utopia mycon) and and [faces of the past](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=faces of the past) for lots of mana. I want to do this with rampagin baloths on the field, and use the mana to cast [Supply](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Supply).
